topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade (Beta): Setting Up the Scenario Environment

body.p: The deployment scenarios require an HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade environment established by the admin user, and set up by end users user1 and user2.
Note: This feature applies only to servers in the VNF Region.

The admin user must define user accounts, shared and external tenant networks, and VM flavors for the end users. The end users user1 and user2 can set up the remaining required resources, including keypairs, private tenant networks, virtual routers, Cinder volumes, Glance images, and virtual machine instances.
For an overview of the components that make up the scenario environment, see Components of the Scenario Environment.
Note: You can set up the scenario environment using the web administration interface or the CLI. For CLI instructions, see Deployment Scenarios Using the CLI.

ol.li:
Use the admin account to complete the following tasks, grouped as Administrative Tasks.
Create tenants
Create users
Set up segmentation ranges on existing provider networks
Set up tenant networks
Set up flavors

Use the user1 and user2 accounts to complete the following tasks on tenant1, grouped as User Tasks.
Create a keypair
Create a private tenant network
Configure the management network
Set up a virtual router
Set up a Cinder volume
Set up a Glance image

body.p: When these tasks have been completed, the environment is ready for scenario deployment.
To deploy a Bridging Scenario, see Deploying the Bridging Scenario.
To deploy a Routing Scenario, see Deploying the Routing Scenario.
